intro: Psychotria zepelaciana, commonly known as the "Liquorice Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its name is derived from the resemblance of its roots to licorice, which has led to its traditional use in some indigenous communities.
